Package org.sat4j.reader

Class Reader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sat4j.reader.Reader
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AAGReader, AIGReader, DimacsReader, InstanceReader, JSONReader, LecteurDimacs
    public abstract class Reader
extends Object
    A reader is responsible to feed an ISolver from a text file and to convert the model found by the solver to a textual representation.
    Author:
    leberre

      • Reader

        public Reader()

    • Method Detail

      • parseInstance

        public IProblem parseInstance​(String filename)
                       throws ParseFormatException,
                              IOException,
                              ContradictionException
        This is the usual method to feed a solver with a benchmark.
        Parameters:
        filename - the fully qualified name of the benchmark. The filename extension may by used to detect which type of benchmarks it is (SAT, OPB, MAXSAT, etc).
        Returns:
        the problem to solve (an ISolver in fact).
        Throws:
        ParseFormatException - if an error occurs during parsing.
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        ContradictionException - if the problem is found trivially inconsistent.

      • getInputStreamFromFilename

        public static InputStream getInputStreamFromFilename​(String filename)
                                              throws IOException,
                                                     MalformedURLException
        This method tries to get an input type from a file, whether it is compressed or not.
        Parameters:
        filename - the file to read in
        Returns:
        a corresponding input stream to read in the file
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O exception occurs
        MalformedURLException - if a provided URL is incorrect

      • parseInstance

        public abstract IProblem parseInstance​(InputStream in)
                                throws ParseFormatException,
                                       ContradictionException,
                                       IOException
        Read a file from a stream. It is important to note that benchmarks are usually encoded in ASCII, not UTF8. As such, the only reasonable way to feed a solver from a stream is to use a stream.
        Parameters:
        in - a stream containing the benchmark.
        Returns:
        the problem to solve (an ISolver in fact).
        Throws:
        ParseFormatException - if an error occurs during parsing.
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        ContradictionException - if the problem is found trivially inconsistent.

      • parseInstance

        @Deprecated
public IProblem parseInstance​(Reader in)
                       throws ParseFormatException,
                              ContradictionException,
                              IOException
        Deprecated.
        Read a file from a reader. Do not use that method, it is no longer supported.
        Parameters:
        in - a stream containing the benchmark.
        Returns:
        the problem to solve (an ISolver in fact).
        Throws:
        ParseFormatException - if an error occurs during parsing.
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        ContradictionException - if the problem is found trivially inconsistent.
        See Also:
        parseInstance(InputStream)

      • decode

        @Deprecated
public abstract String decode​(int[] model)
        Deprecated.
        Produce a model using the reader format. Note that the approach of building a string representation of the model may be quite inefficient when the model is rather large. For that reason, the preferred way to proceed is to directly output the textual representation in a specific PrintWriter using decode(int[], PrintWriter)
        Parameters:
        model - a model using the Dimacs format.
        Returns:
        a human readable view of the model.
        See Also:
        decode(int[], PrintWriter)

      • decode

        public abstract void decode​(int[] model,
                            PrintWriter out)
        Produce a model using the reader format on a provided printwriter.
        Parameters:
        model - a model using the Dimacs format.
        out - the place where to display the model

      • isVerbose

        public boolean isVerbose()

      • setVerbosity

        public void setVerbosity​(boolean b)

      • hasAMapping

        public boolean hasAMapping()
        Does the reader found a mapping.
        Returns:
        true iff the solver found a mapping in the problem
        Since:
        2.3.6

      • getMapping

        public Map<Integer,​String> getMapping()
        Returns the mapping found in the problem.
        Returns:
        the mapping varid->String found in the problem.

      • isUsingMapping

        public boolean isUsingMapping()
        Check if the reader is going to use the mapping available in the file or not.
        Returns:
        true iff the solver will output a model in terms of mapping
        Since:
        2.3.6

      • setUseMapping

        public void setUseMapping​(boolean b)
        Change the behavior of the solver regarding the mapping
        Parameters:
        b - set to true to display the solution in terms of mapped id and false to display dimacs variables.
        Since:
        2.3.6
